thread.title: Media Stocks: International Growth A Fix For Woes?
thread.title_full: Media Stocks: International Growth A Fix For Woes?

title: Media Stocks: International Growth A Fix For Woes?
text:
Following a huge selloff on Wall Street, a trio of tech heavyweights — Google (NASDAQ:GOOGL), Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and IBM (NYSE:IBM) — received analyst upgrades Wednesday morning, while streaming service Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) saw its price target raised. Netflix's stock price rose 4% ... 08:29 AM ET What Rally? Stocks Give Up All Their Gains And Then Some 
Stocks ended Tuesday on a disappointing note as an attempted rebound evaporated and the major market indexes sold off into the close. The S&P 500 fell 1.4% and the Dow Jones industrial average slumped 1.3% while the Nasdaq composite gave up a small gain in the final few minutes and closed down ... 08/25/2015 04:24 PM ET Stocks In Comeback Mode; Skyworks Extends Gains 
Stocks were near their session highs and in rebound mode amid stimulus news out of China and mixed U.S. economic reports. Helped by solar, software, Internet and biotech stocks, the Nasdaq rallied 3.2%. The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones industrial average climbed 2.2% and 2.1%, respectively. Volume ... 08/25/2015 01:55 PM ET Netflix Strikes Telecom Pacts With SoftBank, T-Mobile 
Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) marketing partnership with SoftBank in Japan is a sign of more alliances to come involving telecom companies, says UBS. The SoftBank partnership, announced on Monday, is "further evidence that Netflix is becoming a core part of the telecom promotional rotation," said UBS ... 08/25/2015 11:38 AM ET Stocks Rocket At Starting Bell; Netflix, Apple, Facebook Jump 
Stocks jumped out to broad gains early Tuesday, as a rate cut in China trumped a raft of below-forecast U.S. housing data. The Nasdaq grabbed the early lead with a 3% gain. The S&P 500 swung up 2.3% and the Dow Jones industrial average climbed 2%. Volume was running well below Monday's ... 08/25/2015 10:37 AM ET Salesforce Builds Financial Advisor Cloud, Lofty Goal 
Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM) is trying to become a $10 billion company as well as tap into a target-rich environment, and it may well have made huge strides toward both with its announcement Tuesday of plans to offer wealth management services software to the cloud. The big player in cloud customer ... 08/25/2015 06:56 PM ET Lannett Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates, Guidance Light 
Generic-drug maker Lannett beat Wall Street's fiscal Q4 expectations but guided 2016 sales shy of estimates after the close Tuesday. Lannett's (NYSE:LCI) earnings totaled 91 cents a share in the quarter ended June 30, up 42% from the year-earlier quarter, with sales up 23% to $99 million. Analysts ... 08/25/2015 06:37 PM ET Best Buy beats Q2 views, expands Apple Watch sales 
Best Buy stock jumped Tuesday after the consumer electronics retailer reported much better than expected sales and earnings for its fiscal second quarter, ending Aug. 2. It also announced a deeper partnership with Apple to sell the Apple Watch and other products. Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) stock rose ... 08/25/2015 06:10 PM ET Good Time To Buy Facebook, Amazon, Google: Analyst 
The recent global sell-off in stock markets provides a solid buying opportunity of quality Internet stocks such as Facebook (NASDAQ:FB), says Mizuho Securities. "If the global economy will start to slow, we believe that consumers and businesses would choose to utilize best-in-class services first," ... 08/25/2015 05:43 PM ET Workday Gets Mixed Reviews, But Stock Still Climbs 
Workday (NYSE:WDAY) saw two analysts lower its price target, but it also got an upgrade as shares managed to end higher Tuesday despite the market's ugly close. D.A. Davidson's Jack Andrews lowered his price target on shares of the cloud-based HR software maker to 91 from 97, but he also upgraded ... 08/25/2015 05:25 PM ET
